clinical_study.brief_title: Standing Behavior After Installation of Height-Adjustable Desks
clinical_study.official_title: Adoption of Standing Behavior After Installation of Height-Adjustable Desks

lead_sponsor.agency: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

clinical_study.source: USDA Grand Forks Human Nutrition Research Center

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research study is to determine whether height-adjustable desks change sitting and standing time at work and away from work, engery expenditure, dietary intake, and body composition. Intermittent peroids of standing made possible by height-adjustable desks may help to impart long-term health benefits.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: Workplace sitting time to be reduced
primary_outcome.description: Workplace sitting time will be reduced by 60 minutes across an 8 hour work day and this time will be replaced by standing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Total sitting time will be reduced
secondary_outcome.description: Total sitting time will be reduced by 30 minutes across a 16 hour day. Decreased sitting during the weekday will not be fully compensated for by increased sitting during nonwork hours.
Energy expenditure will increase across an 8 hour workday and a 16 hour day.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health behavior change of consuming a lower fat diet
secondary_outcome.description: The non-targeted health behavior of consuming a lower fat diet will co-occur with standing behavior. Increases in standing behavior will be inversely correlated with changes in total dietary fat intake.

secondary_outcome.measure: Body weight, BMI, and fat mass reduction
secondary_outcome.description: Body weight, BMI, and fast mass will be reduced by 6 months.
Increases in standing behavior will be correlated with changes in musculoskeletal symptoms.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being one of the 18 scientists and support staff who have sedentary jobs
- Voluntarily make the choice to replace their current fixed-height sitting desk for a sit-to-stand height-adjustable desk
- Consents to study conditions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cannot stand for any type of health of orthopedic reasons
- Do not work fulltime
- Pregnant at baseline or become pregnant during the study
